did.unittitle: Thomas Hardy collection

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Autograph letters, signed, from Thomas Hardy to J. M. Barrie, Arthur Locker, Charles S. Prideaux, and others, with letters from his wives, Emma Lavinia Gifford Hardy and Florence Emily Hardy; and writings by Hardy, including an autograph manuscript draft of his novel Far from the Madding Crowd and typescript proofs of a short story, Spectre of the Real . Also includes a photograph of Hardy.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ongoing collection of documents acquired by gift and purchase from various sources. Type of accession (gift or purchase) and date of acquisition is noted in the collection contents. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Thomas Hardy Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Thomas Hardy Collection. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards. For more information, please refer to the Beinecke Manuscript Unit Processing Manual.
Former call numbers: MS Vault Shelves Hardy, Uncat MSS 272, Uncat MS Vault File Hardy, Uncat MSS 274.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Several items are available on microfilm. Consult Public Services staff.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: See also Richard L. Purdy Collection of Thomas Hardy, GEN MSS 111.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Autograph letters, signed, from Thomas Hardy to J. M. Barrie, Arthur Locker, Charles S. Prideaux, and others, with letters from his wives, Emma Lavinia Gifford Hardy and Florence Emily Hardy; and writings by Hardy, including an autograph manuscript draft of his novel Far from the Madding Crowd and typescript proofs of a short story, Spectre of the Real . Also includes a photograph of Hardy.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized in four series: I. Correspondence, 1876-1929. II. Writings, 1873-1919. III. Other Materials, 1889-1920. IV. Additions Since July 1997, 1885-1989.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Thomas Hardy, English novelist and poet.

unittitle.title: Tess of the D'Urbervilles. A Tragedy in Four Acts and a Fore and After-Scene

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Typescript, corrected, signed, of Hardy's dramatization of the novel. Wrapper stamped: "Please return to Curtis Brown Ltd. 116 West 39th St. New York City." Manuscript stitched. With typed letter, signed, from Hardy to Curtis Brown, Ltd., 1925 January 6. Accompanied by autograph letter, signed, from Gertrude Bugler to "Mr. Allan," 1928 October 24; typed letter, signed, and typed envelope from Richard Purdy to Frederick Baldwin Adams, Jr., 1946 February 17; and catalogue entry, annotated by Frederick Baldwin Adams, Jr., undated. Housed in a quarter morocco blue slipcase, gilt title on spine. Bookplate: Frederick Baldwin Adams, Jr.

scopecontent.p: 1 item ; 18 cm. Answering a letter from Symonds on a remark on "the charm of the Middle Ages." Symonds, 1978 Apr 15; manuscript notes on Henry Symonds, undated; photocopy of published text of the letter; and advertising matter, undated.
